alert.note: Alert for Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 17 at 12:31PM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...Possible Flash Flooding Conditions into the Weekend... A monsoonal trough just north of the territory will linger and move over the islands Friday into the weekend. This feature will increase the potential for flash flooding conditions over the islands peaking Friday night into the weekend. Periods of heavy showers and gusty winds during heavy downpours is expected Friday night through the weekend, possibly extending into the new week. Model data are suggesting a high pressure to the east-northeast will move into the region and push the trough south and west on Sunday. Although the trough will move away from the area, embedded showers within the easterly flow will produce moist conditions over the territory for the new week. Therefore, please keep up to date with the latest forecast information through our website (weather.gov/ppg), local media, social media, or NOAA Weather Radio broadcats. An updated outlook will be issued by 10 PM SST Sunday, or sooner if necessary.

area.areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu
